DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is effective for insomnia in lung cancer survivors.
DOC.brief_title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)-Insomnia for Lung Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: A randomized controlled clinical trial will be used to test the efficacy of this brief CBT-I compared to attention control on sleep, mood, functional status and quality of life in lung cancer survivors and evaluate the feasibility of translating an evidence-based CBT-I into the clinical setting.
DOC.criteria: 6 weeks from surgery for stage 1 or 2 Non Small Cell Lung Cancer chronic insomnia Other preexisting sleep disorders Unstable medical illnesses
